Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Wooden stake
Description: Conical wooden stake with a groove 0,5 cm in width at the upper extremity. This groove was most probably used to hold a strap or cordage. This stake was cut, shaped on a lathe and then trimmed at its lower extremity. It could have been used to fix an object  to the ground, such as a canvas or animal skin shelter (not unlike a modern tent).
